Caloocan: Caloocan is a vibrant city in Metro Manila known for its diverse urban environment. It has a rich history and is home to landmarks like the Bonifacio Monument. Caloocan offers shopping centers, entertainment venues, and a vibrant lifestyle.
Manila: Manila is the capital city of the Philippines, situated on the eastern shore of Manila Bay. It is a bustling metropolis with a mix of historical landmarks, modern infrastructure, and a vibrant street life. Manila is a cultural, economic, and political center of the country.
Mandaluyong: Mandaluyong is a city in Metro Manila known for its central location and vibrant business district. It is a rapidly developing urban area with many commercial and residential establishments.
Marikina: Marikina is a city in Metro Manila famous for its shoe industry and for being one of the cleanest and greenest cities in the Philippines. It is known for its parks, riverbanks, and the Marikina River.
Makati: Makati is another city in Metro Manila and is the financial center of the Philippines. It is a major business and commercial hub, home to many multinational corporations, upscale shopping malls, and high-end residential areas.
Malabon: Malabon is a city in Metro Manila known for its coastal location and fish industry. It is situated along the coast of Manila Bay and is known for its fresh seafood, particularly its pancit malabon, a local noodle dish.
Muntinlupa: Muntinlupa is a city in Metro Manila that is primarily residential but also has some industrial areas. It is home to upscale residential subdivisions, commercial centers, and the famous Filinvest City business district.
Navotas: Navotas is a coastal city in Metro Manila known for its thriving fishing industry. Situated along Manila Bay, it offers picturesque views and is famous for its fresh seafood and bustling fish ports.
Parañaque: Parañaque is a city in Metro Manila located near Manila Bay. It is known for its entertainment and gaming complex called Entertainment City, which houses several integrated resorts and casinos.
Pasay: Pasay is a city in Metro Manila known for its transportation hubs and entertainment centers. It is home to the Ninoy Aquino International Airport, several shopping malls, and the Cultural Center of the Philippines.
Pasig: Pasig is a city in Metro Manila bisected by the Pasig River. It is a major residential and industrial center and is known for its business districts, commercial areas, and recreational spots like the Ortigas Center.
Quezon City: Quezon City is the largest city in Metro Manila and the most populous city in the Philippines. It is a highly urbanized city known for its commercial centers, educational institutions, and government offices.
San Juan: San Juan is the smallest city in Metro Manila but is known for its historical and cultural significance. It is home to various historical sites, including the Pinaglabanan Shrine and the Santuario del Santo Cristo.
Taguig: Taguig is a city in Metro Manila known for its rapid urban development and modern lifestyle. It is home to the Bonifacio Global City (BGC), a thriving financial district, as well as upscale residential areas and commercial centers.
Valenzuela: Valenzuela is a city in Metro Manila known for its industrial and commercial areas. It is an important industrial center and is home to numerous manufacturing and processing plants.
Las Piñas: Las Piñas is a city in Metro Manila known for its historical and cultural attractions. It is famous for the Las Piñas Bamboo Organ, a unique musical instrument made of bamboo, and the annual Zapote Festival.
Pateros: Pateros is a small municipality within Metro Manila known for its cultural heritage and traditional industry. It is famous for producing the world-renowned Pateros duck eggs, locally known as "balut." Pateros also celebrates the colorful street dance festival called "Karakol."
